intro: Lepicephalus atratus, commonly known as the black-headed grasshopper, is a species of short-horned grasshopper found in various parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acrididae and is characterized by its robust body and distinctive black head. The plant-related aspects of this species are not directly relevant, as it is an insect rather than a plant. However, it plays a role in the ecological interactions within its habitat, particularly in grassland ecosystems. Its presence can influence the growth and distribution of vegetation through grazing activities.
